articles.author: Tetsushi Kajimoto, Leika Kihara
articles.description: Japan will take appropriate steps against excessive moves in the yen "without ruling out any options", Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Wednesday, keeping markets on alert over the chance of yen-buying intervention.
articles.title: Japan will take appropriate steps vs excessive yen moves - finance min

articles.author: Yoruk Bahceli, Karin Strohecker, Dhara Ranasinghe
articles.description: The world's biggest bond markets are in the throes of another rout as a new era of higher for longer interest rates takes hold.
articles.title: Why a rout in government bonds is worrying

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States on Tuesday announced actions against Chinese companies and people as President Joe Biden's administration targets trafficking of the deadly drug fentanyl, unsealing indictments and imposing sanctions on dozens of targets.
articles.title: US takes action against Chinese companies, people tied to fentanyl

articles.author: Katie Paul
articles.description: Meta (META.O) is planning to lay off employees on Wednesday in the unit of its metaverse-oriented Reality Labs division focused on creating custom silicon, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Meta to lay off employees in metaverse silicon unit on Wednesday

articles.author: Valerie Insinna, Rajesh Singh
articles.description: United Airlines (UAL.O) on Tuesday announced an order for 110 aircraft from Boeing (BA.N) and Airbus (AIR.PA) for delivery beginning in 2028 as it seeks to expand its international network.
articles.title: United Airlines orders 110 Airbus, Boeing jets in a bet on travel demand

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) said on Tuesday it was laying off another 163 workers in Ohio because of the ongoing United Auto Workers strike at two assembly plants and 18 parts distribution centers.
articles.title: GM furloughs another 163 workers due to UAW strike

articles.author: Pranav Kiran
articles.description: Anil Agarwal is Asia’s latest unconvincing new believer in shareholder value. The Indian tycoon and perennial restructurer plans to split his $10 billion Mumbai-listed mining company Vedanta (VDAN.NS) into six separately listed units spanning aluminium to copper. It will create businesses that are easier for the market to appreciate. As with other big breakups in the region however, there are unspoken reasons for him to join the party.
articles.title: Asia’s breakup party is happening under duress

articles.author: David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: Allies of embattled U.S. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy on Tuesday moved to block a challenge to his leadership by a fellow Republican, plunging the chamber into an intra-party dispute that could tip Congress into chaos.
articles.title: McCarthy sets up US House vote on challenge to his leadership

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia has no plans for an additional mobilisation of men to fight in Ukraine as more than 335,000 have signed up so far this year to fight in the armed forces or voluntary units, Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia says 335,000 sign up to fight, no plans for new mobilisation

articles.author: Mikhail Flores, Karen Lema
articles.description: The Philippines is investigating a maritime incident to find out what killed three Filipino fishermen in a ramming incident that sank their boat in the South China Sea, its president said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Philippines looking into ramming incident in South China Sea -president
